Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of U Chi Son 
    Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of the late U Chi Son, a ceramist of the Mansudae Art Studio who is winner of Kim Il Sung Prize and People's Artist, on November 9, expressing deep condolences on his death.

articles.title: S. Korean Unionists' Anti-"Government" Actions
articles.content:
Strike in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The (south) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions staged a strike on November 6 demanding an end to the discrimination against the part-time workers, etc., according to MBC of south Korea.
 It was participated in by at least 120,000 members of the KCTU including the Hyundai Motor Trade Union and the Metal Industry Trade Union.
 They declared that they would carry on the struggle till the policy of suppressing workers is renounced, holding that the government's improvement proposal concerning the system of discriminating against the part-time workers, etc. is not in line with the workers' demand.

articles.content:
Greetings to President of Angola
    Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Angolan President Jose Eduardo Dos Santos on the occasion of the 28th anniversary of the independence of Angola, the national holiday of the Angolan people.
 The message expressed the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and develop and wished the president and the people of Angola greater success in their work for durable peace, security and prosperity of the country.
